page.title: 04Farming in Rogate
page.content: Slade farm is bigger than most of the farms in the area. It grows wheat, barley, kale,grass and turnips together with ten potato fields. The farm produces about 3000 tons of corn a year. The soil is a light brown colour and sandy. There are no sheep on the land so the farmer has no sheep dog,but he does have 150 milking cows, one bull and 1550 beef cattle. The cows eat kale,hay, straw, silage, rape and dairy nuts. The milk is collected by a daily tanker. We were very surprised when we heard that they used 3000 tons of dung on the fields. The farmer has 15 men helpers and 12 ladies some of whom work part time sorting, grading and picking the potatoes.
